Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior bears traces of a light-brown slip and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as 'for the domain of the king's daughter Mery-[...]'.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:21-22/587 Main City
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten 1:164 Pl. LXIII fig. R
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393118) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393118)
